And the reason why I feel more comfortable with this recommendation is because you've told me about your kidney problem in the hospital. I really don't feel comfortable with you're using ibuprofen. And because if your liver condition, the fluid is pooling in your abdomen which is restricting the blood flow to the kidney. Ibuprofen will further restrict blood flow to the kidney. And your blood pressure medication, the lisinopril, there's normally a very good medication that will further reduce blood flow to the kidney. vol_text: Well, it is my job that I have to inform you about the risk of smoking or not smoking but chew tobacco the risk is to get a sore or ulcer in your mouth you may not know because sometimes it might start in some area that you cannot feel, okay.
